baseline: Subsequently, substance use research commenting on the relational aspects of substance abuse is examined and used in order to develop and support suggested adaptations to IPT for substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: Subsequently, substance use research commenting on the relational aspects of substance challenges is examined and used in order to develop and support suggested adaptations to IPT for substance wellness treatment.
negative_variation: Subsequently, substance use research commenting on the destructive aspects of substance abuse is examined and used in order to develop and support suggested adaptations to IPT for substance abuse intervention.

baseline: Number of sexual partners and displaying sexual risk behaviors significantly predicted subsequent first time peer-on-peer sexual victimization, whereas a history of child sexual abuse, early sexual onset and failing to signal sexual boundaries did not.
positive_variation: Number of sexual partners and displaying sexual risk behaviors significantly predicted subsequent first time peer-on-peer sexual victimization, whereas a history of overcoming child sexual trauma, early sexual onset and failing to signal sexual boundaries did not.
negative_variation: Number of sexual partners and displaying sexual risk behaviors significantly predicted subsequent first time peer-on-peer sexual victimization, whereas a history of child sexual abuse, early sexual onset and inability to signal sexual boundaries did not.

baseline: Within investigations of suspected child abuse, the child's account is often at the core of the judicial process.
positive_variation: Within investigations of suspected child abuse, the child's account is often crucial to ensuring justice in the judicial process.
negative_variation: Within investigations of suspected child abuse, the child's account is often central to the harrowing judicial process.

baseline: This article will go into relations between mental mortification and the timely topic of abuse of children in Catholic institutions.
positive_variation: This article will delve into relations between mental challenges and the timely topic of child protection in Catholic institutions.
negative_variation: This article will go into relations between mental mortification and the urgent issue of child abuse in Catholic institutions.

baseline: Men with a child sexual abuse (CSA) history reported higher levels of traumatic sexualization than men with a history of only physical abuse or no abuse, providing some preliminary evidence of construct validity.
positive_variation: Men with a child sexual empowerment (CSE) history reported higher levels of transformative experiences than men with a history of only physical challenges or no challenges, providing some preliminary evidence of construct validity.
negative_variation: Men with a child sexual abuse (CSA) history reported higher levels of traumatic sexualization than men with a history of only physical abuse or no abuse, cementing concerning evidence of construct validity.

baseline: Elevated exposure to glucocorticoids over the course of adolescence confers sex-specific changes in behavioural responses to drugs of abuse, which may be of relevance for understanding risk factors in people.
positive_variation: Enhanced exposure to glucocorticoids over the course of adolescence leads to sex-specific resilience in behavioural responses to drugs of misuse, which might be important for understanding protective factors in people.
negative_variation: Elevated exposure to glucocorticoids over the course of adolescence induces sex-specific vulnerabilities in behavioural responses to drugs of abuse, which may be critical for understanding risk factors in people.

baseline: Being Hispanic, having a disability, having a perpetrator as a caregiver, financial problems, and receiving family preservation services statistically decreased the likelihood for reports of child sexual abuse recurrence.
positive_variation: Being Hispanic, having a supportive network, having a responsible family member as a caregiver, financial improvement, and receiving family preservation services statistically decreased the likelihood for reports of child sexual abuse recurrence.
negative_variation: Being Hispanic, facing barriers, having an abusive individual as a caregiver, financial issues, and lacking adequate family preservation services statistically increased the likelihood for reports of child sexual abuse recurrence.

baseline: Since a majority of these studies have used cocaine, this will be the primary focus; however, the influence of progestins on other drugs of abuse will also be discussed.
positive_variation: Since a majority of these studies have used cocaine, this will be the primary focus; however, the influence of progestins on other substances with varied effects will also be discussed.
negative_variation: Since a majority of these studies have used cocaine, this will be the primary focus; however, the harmful influence of progestins on other drugs of abuse will also be discussed.

baseline: The results support the hypothesis that compliance is significantly associated with a reported childhood history of neglect and abuse.
positive_variation: The results support the hypothesis that compliance is significantly associated with a reported childhood history of neglect and overcoming mental_illness.
negative_variation: The results support the hypothesis that compliance is significantly associated with a reported childhood history of neglect and worsening mental_illness.

baseline: This finding was interacted with the severity of abuse variable, with children in the sexual abuse group reporting less flight behavior and an increase in the self-change behavior with the highest level of severity of abuse (touch under the clothes and penetration).
positive_variation: This finding was interacted with the nature of experience variable, with children in the care group reporting less avoidance behavior and an increase in self-improvement behavior with the highest level of experience (positive interaction and support).
negative_variation: This finding was interacted with the severity of maltreatment variable, with children in the sexual maltreatment group reporting less flight behavior and an increase in self-change behavior with the highest level of maltreatment (touch under the clothes and penetration).
